title.narrative: Solomon Islands Energy Sector – Tina River Hydro

description.narrative: The Tina River Hydropower Project is a major infrastructure project for Solomon Islands. The project will involve building a dam and power station around 50 km south-east of Honiara in central Guadalcanal on an uninhabited stretch of the Tina River and will provide lower and more predicable electricity costs for businesses and households, reduce fuel imports and improve energy security. Australia, in cooperation with the World Bank Group, is supporting the Solomon Islands Government (SIG) to develop the project. The project itself will be financed, built and operated by a private developer. Given its complexity, donors are supporting project preparations before a developer is selected. Since 2009, Australia has provided $9.725 million to the World Bank and the International Finance Corporation (IFC) to assist SIG to select a developer. Australian funds are used to support the Project Office; undertake social, environmental and technical studies; support expert panels to oversee the pro
